methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
A constructor that does not use the source or destination data type managers.  In terms of
 the source data type manager, this means that all data type managers will be used when
 resolving data types.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: sourceDataTypeManager
params.comment: preferred source data-type manager, or null

params.name: dataTypeManagerService
params.comment: data-type manager tool service, or null

params.name: allowedTypes
params.comment: constrains which data-types may be parsed

methods.name: parse

params.name: dataTypeString
params.comment: a known data-type name followed by zero or more pointer/array decorations.

throws.comment: if data-type string is invalid or length exceeds specified maxSize

return.comment: parsed data-type or null if not found

methods.name: parse
methods.comment:
Parse a data-type string specification with category path.  If category is not null,
 the dataTypeManagerService will not be queried.

params.name: dataTypeString
params.comment: a known data-type name followed by zero or more pointer/array decorations.

params.name: category
params.comment: known path of data-type or null if unknown

throws.comment: if data-type string is invalid or length exceeds specified maxSize
parse cancelled through user interaction (only if parser contructed with service)

return.comment: parsed data-type or null if not found

methods.name: parse
methods.comment: Parse a data-type string specification using the specified baseDatatype.

params.name: dataTypeString
params.comment:
a base data-type followed by a sequence of zero or more pointer/array decorations to be applied.
 The string may start with the baseDataType's name.

params.name: suggestedBaseDataType
params.comment:
base data-type (may be null), this will be used as the base data-type if
 its name matches the base name in the specified dataTypeString.

throws.comment: if data-type string is invalid or length exceeds specified maxSize
parse cancelled through user interaction (only if parser contructed with service)

return.comment: parsed data-type or null if not found

methods.name: ensureIsAllowableType
methods.comment: Throws exception if the data type does not match the specified AllowedDataTypes.

params.name: allowedTypes
params.comment: AllowedDataTypes specifying what category of data types are ok

throws.comment: if dt violates the specified allowedTypes
